column1: One day Fred found an old saddle in the stable; and he proposed to Bertie to help him put it on the calf
column2: and have a ride the length of her rope. They succeeded in fastening it upon Buttercup's smooth back; and Freddie exclaimed with delight
column3: "Now we will have a first-class circus!"They brought a chair from the house
column4: and placed it by the side of Miss Cow
column5: she looking wonderingly at them with great round eyes. The boys both stood together in the chair
column10: we must spring upon the saddle. One—two—three—four;" and on they went.But
column11: before they could have said "five" Miss Buttercup's heels were in the air
column12: and her head went down so quickly
column13: that Master Fred felt a sudden chill
column14: and found himself in a tub of rain-water that stood under the eaves of the wood-shed; while Bertie went head-foremost into a pan of meal and water.
